intro: Neomuretia amplifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf muretia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 12 inches in length. It produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring. Neomuretia amplifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and thickets.
